text:
A customer is trying to migrate from Spotler to HS. But he runs into problems

```I do run into a bit of a problem with the fact that we have so many variables that we can now just throw in freely in Spotler, but in HS a variable has to be predefined for each value, in eg Contact or Company. That doesn't feel right.

I tried to add a text field "blob" (short for binary large object) in a Contact. The idea was to pop in a bit of data which we can then apply in the mails, that seemed like a very clear and nice idea, but unfortunately HubSpot makes this impossible in the mails; the field will be replaced in it later so I can't do any edits to it in the form of HuBL (HubSpot Language) edits...that took me some time.

For the mail to, for example, I can think of something that we pre-format an HTML block with all the data in it and post this value in a Contact variable via the API, but that really feels like a setback compared to Spotler.```
Anyone got some ideas on this matter?

>  but unfortunately HubSpot makes this impossible in the mails; the field will be replaced in it later so I can’t do any edits to it in the form of HuBL (HubSpot Language) 
What do you mean exactly here?
I guess using the data in de blob to inject into the email
So data put into a contact property? I’m unsure at what point they are saying it is getting replaced or how it is getting replaced exactly

I wonder if this is the way to go. As I understand. Spotler don't limit you on using params. It just collects them and the become usable. HS needs predefined params.

May I can get into a call later where he can explains me what his is setting up. To get more context
basically he is setting op some kind of dynamic form, so he don't know the fields that needs to be added to the contact in crm. Since the are dynamic

Hi, I'm having issues with IF Statements and variables that contain the line item name, but I'm struggling to get the IF statement to work as it will always return the "Else".
Screenshot of my custom module code below, any help would be greatly appreciated
Do let me know when you get a bit more detail

Hey <@U02MEH46G13>, statments like `is string_containing` aren’t supported in email yet. However, if you use the Programable email beta you can use them <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/create-programmable-emails>
How can I get a style tag into the <head> of drag and drop emails? Need to add in a media query.
Is this what you are looking for......but I don't think <style> supports media queries <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/can-i-add-css-to-the-head-section-of-my-email-templates>
Unfortunately this can't be used inside drag and drop templates
I haven't seen a way to add media queriers for drag and drop emails, unfortunately.
